Name: Fallow
Effect: When you use the Recover action, shape tiles equal to essence gained.

Name: Surefooted
Effect: Ignore the effects of difficult terrain. You have advantage on skill checks made to navigate challenging landscapes outside of combat. When you take this feat, sacrifice an exploration feat.

Name: Ecotone
Effect: Choose another damage type. Your manifestations deal hybrid damage and you gain resistance to that damage type.

Name: Polyculture
Effect: Choose an additional terrain type. You can decide which one to create and can overlay them.

Name: Biodiversity
Effect: Choose a second ailment and a second affliction. Can always choose which one to apply.

Name: Wild Growth
Effect: Passively shape twice as many tiles with Overgrowth feature, radius reduced to 2 tiles.

Name: Natural Immunity
Effect: Ignore the effects of your own terrain.

Name: Tenacious Growth
Effect: At the start of each of your turns, restore any of your terrain that were removed the Interact action.

Name: Unstoppable Force
Effect: You have advantage on all attacks that apply forced movement.

Name: Immovable Object
Effect: While you have absorption, you are immune to forced movement.

Name: Power Draw
Effect: You have advantage on Recover and Essence Tap skill checks made while on a shaped tile.

Name: Gently Sloped
Effect: Whenever you would create a tile of hilly terrain, you may choose to shape two tiles instead. If you do, all edges are gradual.

Name: Propagate
Effect: 3 essence: Copy each terrain into an adjacent tile if able. Uses all three uses of Wildshaping.

Name: Home Ground
Effect: You have advantage on basic attacks while on your terrain.

Name: Restraint
Effect: You can choose not to activate your Overgrowth feature.

Name: Biomimickry
Effect: When you would use a targeted action, you may pay 1 essence and choose a tile that contains your terrain. If you do, you may use that action as if you were occupying that tile instead.

Name: Secret Paths
Effect: 3 essence: Teleport from a tile of your terrain to any other tile of your terrain. Uses all three uses of Wildshaping. Can choose to activate Overgrowth before or after moving, but always occurs after targeting.
